page.title: 12Silaging in Dundrennan
page.content: Of the ten farms in our area half of them produce silage.The silage is cut late May/early June and during that time many tractors and trailers can be seen on the roads. When the silage has been cut,it is put into a silage pit and then sheeted with black tarpaulin,weighted by tyres. The silage is ready for use in late September,and is used to feed the older calves,cows and sheep.Farms without silage feed hay and barley to their beasts. Two of the local farms,Newlaw and Overlaw produce 11.47% and 26.37% silage respectively.There are silage pits at each farm.There are four silos at Newlaw and Overlaw combined,for storing grain.
